SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp

Interface SMTPConnectionMetadata

All Known Implementing Classes:
SMTPConnection
public interface SMTPConnectionMetadata
Interface providing metadata about an SMTP connection for policy decisions. This interface exposes relevant information about the client connection that an SMTP handler might need to make informed decisions about sender and recipient policies.

The metadata includes:

  • Network information (client IP, local server details)
  • Security context (SSL/TLS status, client certificates)
  • Authentication state (username, authentication method)
  • Connection properties (secure channel, connection time)

This allows handlers to implement sophisticated policies based on:

  • Source IP reputation and geolocation
  • Client certificate validation
  • Authentication status and user identity
  • Connection security and encryption
Author:
Chris Burdess
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getClientAddress

      InetSocketAddress getClientAddress()
      Returns the client's remote socket address. Useful for IP-based policies, geolocation, and reputation checks.
      Returns:
      the client socket address

    • getServerAddress

      InetSocketAddress getServerAddress()
      Returns the server's local socket address. Useful for determining which connector/port received the connection.
      Returns:
      the server socket address

    • isSecure

      boolean isSecure()
      Returns whether the connection is encrypted with SSL/TLS.
      Returns:
      true if the connection uses SSL/TLS encryption

    • getClientCertificates

      X509Certificate[] getClientCertificates()
      Returns the client's X.509 certificates if provided. Only available for secure connections with client certificate authentication.
      Returns:
      client certificates or null if none provided

    • getCipherSuite

      String getCipherSuite()
      Returns the TLS cipher suite in use. Only available for secure connections.
      Returns:
      cipher suite name or null if connection is not secure

    • getProtocolVersion

      String getProtocolVersion()
      Returns the TLS protocol version in use. Only available for secure connections.
      Returns:
      protocol version (e.g., "TLSv1.3") or null if not secure

    • getConnectionTimeMillis

      long getConnectionTimeMillis()
      Returns the timestamp when the connection was established. Useful for connection duration tracking and timeout policies.
      Returns:
      connection establishment time in milliseconds since epoch

    • getConnectionDurationMillis

      default long getConnectionDurationMillis()
      Returns the connection duration in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      milliseconds since connection was established

    • getDSNEnvelopeParameters

      DSNEnvelopeParameters getDSNEnvelopeParameters()
      Returns the DSN envelope parameters from the MAIL FROM command.

      These parameters indicate how the sender wants Delivery Status Notifications handled for this message:

      • RET - Whether to return the full message or just headers in DSNs
      • ENVID - An opaque envelope identifier for correlation
      Returns:
      DSN envelope parameters, or null if none were specified
      See Also:
      • DSNEnvelopeParameters

    • getDSNRecipientParameters

      DSNRecipientParameters getDSNRecipientParameters(EmailAddress recipient)
      Returns the DSN recipient parameters for a specific recipient.

      These parameters indicate when to send Delivery Status Notifications for this recipient:

      • NOTIFY - When to send DSNs (NEVER, SUCCESS, FAILURE, DELAY)
      • ORCPT - The original recipient address before any forwarding
      Parameters:
      recipient - the recipient to get DSN parameters for
      Returns:
      DSN recipient parameters, or null if none were specified
      See Also:
      • DSNRecipientParameters

    • isRequireTls

      boolean isRequireTls()
      Returns whether REQUIRETLS was specified for this message.

      When true, the sender has indicated that this message must only be transmitted over TLS-protected connections (RFC 8689). If the server cannot guarantee TLS protection to the next hop during relay, the message should be bounced rather than delivered insecurely.

      Returns:
      true if REQUIRETLS was specified in MAIL FROM
